title: Will Chancellor Sajid Javid really abolish inheritance tax?
text:
The Chancellor Sajid Javid has raised hopes of an end to Britain’s most hated levy, hinting at a fringe event at the Conservative party conference that inheritance tax (IHT) could be scrapped.

He said changes to the death duty were “on his mind”, calling the fact that IHT receipts had reached a record £5.4bn in 2018-19 “a real issue”. He spoke of its unfairness on families who face additional taxation on what is often already-taxed life savings.

But critics say hopes for reform are misguided and that promises to overhaul the dreaded tax are more often than not empty promises. Not only this but experts have said previous attempts to fix the tax have resulted in a more complicated system.
